comments.body: This is meta: I'm wondering if return a collection of errors would help, since users do not have any information on which nodes returns each error. For example, how would user learn more with two UnknownTopicOrPartition errors compared with just getting one? My feeling is it may create more confusion than more information it brings.

Users do have information on which nodes returned errors, though: the exception text always mentions a node name.

Some code may choose to only look at the exception code, which is also a valid choice (in general some exception codes should be retried, others not.)  But printing the exception text, which most code will also do, will help clear up what is going on in the cluster.
@cmccabe Why are we returning `KafkaFutureImpl` here and a few other places?
